input_text:
Job Title: Jr. Weld Engineer

Location: Ethridge, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Number: 66145

Group: Cosma

Division: Magna Structures Tennessee

Job Type: Jr. Weld Engineer

Location: Lawrenceburg, Tennessee

About Us

We see a future where everyone can live and move without limitations. That’s why we are developing technologies, systems and concepts that make vehicles safer and cleaner, while serving our communities, the planet and, above all, people.

Forward. For all.

Group Summary

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

About The Role

PURPOSE OF POSITION:

Weld Engineers are responsible for management and support of all plant weld systems and documentation, and for working with Engineering on new weld machine controls and standards. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability, and essential duties required to successfully perform this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This is a salaried position, primarily on first shift.

Your Responsibilities

RESPONSIBILITY AND AUTHORITY:

Adhere to and comply with and exceed where possible all applicable federal, state, and OSHA environmental, health and safety laws, regulations, external & internal standards, and other requirements in all its operations which relate to its health, safety, and environmental aspects.

Familiarity with Engineering and Quality practices and procedures including APQP, PPAP, blueprint reading, GD&T, use of measuring instruments, checking aids / fixtures, computer applications, mechanical testing, and customer and IATF 16949 requirements.

Good organizational, leadership, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills

Ensure Team Members use or wear the protective equipment required by Magna Structures Tennessee LLC.

Members of any potential hazards and/or provide written instructions as to the measures to protect the Team Member

Take every precaution reasonable in the circumstances for the protection of a Team Member and report any known contravention out of their control to their BU Leader/Manager

Conduct accident / incident investigations and implement corrective actions and Continued Improvements

Conduct monthly safety inspections and implement corrective actions.

Correct unsafe acts or conditions.

Correct or commends health & safety performance.

Who We Are Looking For

KNOWLEDGE:

Proficiency with Advanced Product Quality Planning methods

Strong Computer Skills Are Required.

Knowledge in OSHA safety requirements

Strong experience / knowledge in robotic programming for welding processes, preferably using Fanuc or MotoMan equipment.

EDUCATION:

4 Year Weld Engineering Degree or equivalent

WORK EXPERIENCE:

Minimum 3 - 5 years’ experience in an automotive welding engineering, design, and program development environment

Resistance Welding Experience Required.

Prior experience in weld laboratory duties

Your Preferred Qualifications

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITIONS:

Provide technical welding expertise to the weld lab, including personnel, equipment, documents, and records of compliance. Evaluate and make recommendations regarding current and new weld assembly processing, tooling, and equipment.

Provide Engineering and Quality Assurance personnel as assigned with welding expertise to support existing and new customer programs.

Develop and implement training and certification program for production associates in robotic and hand GMAW/TIG welding techniques and procedures.

Develop and implement work instructions for part fit-up, tack, weld, and repair requirements.

Develop and implement parameters for weld length, leg length, throat length, penetration, and structural quality for welded automotive assemblies.

Develop and implement a training program for maintenance technicians in the troubleshooting and repair of robotic GMAW welding equipment.

Develop and implement a training program for troubleshooting and problem solving of welding issues.

Participate in APQP processes relating to the design of weld assembly work cells and tooling.

Recommend design changes to improve quality, reliability, and productivity of welding processes.

Develop and implement documents and procedures for validation of welding equipment and processes to meet or exceed customer specifications.

Supervise and manage the setup and programming of robots for welding.

Promote continual improvement in weld quality and weld processes.

Maintain weld drawings.

Achieve department objectives in support of company production, quality, and safety goals.

Work effectively with Q.A., Engineering and Production departments’ associates for continual improvement of department methods, procedures, and policies; assist in the implementation of.

Communicate effectively with company personnel, customers, and vendors.

Attend and participate in department meetings, plant meetings, and training; participate in customer visitations as designated by the department manager.

Support new program launches and customer expectations.

Provide reports as required by the Engineering Manager or other departments.

Participate in Continual Improvement activities.

Adhere to customer requirements, Business Operating System, and company policies.

Perform other duties as assigned.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Able to use computer and software as required.

Able to travel.

Able to demonstrate understanding of how job performance affects product quality and customer satisfaction.

Able to work well with others; build and maintain positive employee relations.

Able to prepare, read, write, and interpret written reports, procedures, instructions, and guidelines.

Able to effectively present information and respond to questions from management, employees, suppliers and customers and work effectively within a team environment.

Able to organize, schedule, and manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.

Able to use computer and software as required.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The work environment is a combination of office and manufacturing plant, with an emphasis on manufacturing plant. The individual must be able to perform all essential functions as appropriate on the plant floor, in meetings, and with employees, management, customers and suppliers.

Flexible hours are required.

Requires travel to customer and tooling facilities as needed.

Able To Work Flexible And Additional Hours As Required.

Able to travel.

EQUIPMENT / TOOLS USED:

Some of the equipment and tools used are computer, telephone, fax machine, copier/printer, and a projector.

What We Offer

Competitive Salary, Medical/Dental/Vision/Prescription, Paid Vacation/Holidays, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, 401K Match.

Site Benefits

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
